2025-01-01.title: A New Beginning
2025-01-01.verse: 2 Corinthians 5:17 - Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, she is a new creation. The old has passed away; behold, the new has come.
2025-01-01.text: As the clock strikes midnight on the first day of the year, we are presented with a unique opportunity for a new beginning. The apostle Paul reminds us that in Christ, we are a 'new creation.' This isn't just a poetic declaration; it's a spiritual reality. The past, with its failures and regrets, is gone. In this new year, the Lord offers you a clean slate. Leave yesterday's burdens behind and embrace the identity He has given you. A new beginning doesn't mean everything will be easy, but it does mean you have a faithful partner with you every step of the way. Focus on who you are in Him and the purpose He has for you. What habit do you want to leave behind? What spiritual discipline do you want to adopt? Take the first step today on this path of renewal.

2025-01-02.title: Walking in Purpose
2025-01-02.verse: Jeremiah 29:11 - For I know the plans I have for you, declares the Lord, plans for welfare and not for evil, to give you a future and a hope.
2025-01-02.text: God has a plan for your life, a vision that goes beyond your own aspirations. Jeremiah 29:11 assures us that His plans are 'for welfare and not for calamity.' This is a promise of hope and a reminder that your life has a divine purpose. As women, we often feel the pressure to be successful or to have all the answers. However, our true purpose is not found in what we do, but in who we are in Christ. He has given us gifts and talents to use for His glory. Are you living according to His calling? Or are you chasing your own ambitions? Today, take a moment to pray and ask God to show you His will for your life. Purpose is not a destination, but a path that is revealed daily.

2025-01-03.title: A Mother's Legacy
2025-01-03.verse: Deuteronomy 6:6-7 - And these words that I command you today shall be on your heart. You shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way, and when you lie down, and when you rise.
2025-01-03.text: As mothers, our role goes beyond just providing. Deuteronomy 6 challenges us to be the primary spiritual teachers for our children, instilling faith in them constantly. 'You shall teach them diligently to your children, and shall talk of them when you sit in your house, and when you walk by the way...' This reminds us that our influence is continuous and omnipresent. Faith is not taught in a single moment, but in the daily routine of life. For a Christian woman, this means living an authentic and transparent faith so our children can see in us what it means to follow Christ. How can you intentionally incorporate faith into your family routine today? Maybe it's a prayer before a meal, a Bible story before bed, or simply talking about how God worked in your day. Your greatest legacy isn't what you leave in the bank, but what you leave in the hearts of your children.

2025-01-04.title: Discipline for the Spirit
2025-01-04.verse: 1 Timothy 4:7-8 - Rather train yourself for godliness; for while bodily training is of some value, godliness is of value in every way, as it holds promise for the present life and also for the life to come.
2025-01-04.text: Discipline is a word we often associate with the gym or our job. But what about our spiritual life? 1 Timothy 4:7-8 urges us to 'discipline yourself for the purpose of godliness.' Just as physical exercise is vital for our bodies, spiritual training is crucial for our growth. This involves dedicating time to prayer, reading the Bible, worship, and fellowship with other believers. These disciplines are not a burden, but a means to grow in our relationship with God and to strengthen our faith in the face of trials. What spiritual routine can you establish for this new year? Can you commit to spending 15 minutes each morning in prayer? Or to reading one chapter of the Bible a day? A woman of faith is not one who waits for strength, but one who disciplines herself to get it from God.

2025-01-05.title: A Visionary's Path
2025-01-05.verse: Proverbs 29:18 - Where there is no prophetic vision the people cast off restraint, but blessed is he who keeps the law.
2025-01-05.text: Without a clear vision, life becomes a directionless wander. Proverbs 29:18 reminds us, 'Where there is no vision, the people perish.' As women, we are called to be visionaries, not just in our work, but in all areas of our lives. A visionary doesn't just react to circumstances; she sets a course, motivating others to follow. In a Christian context, this means seeking God's direction for our family, our career, and our personal life. What vision do you have for your marriage? For your children? For your personal growth? This is the time to pray and ask God to give you a clear vision for this year. It's not about worldly goals, but about a heavenly perspective that glorifies God and guides you toward the purpose He has set for you.

2025-01-06.title: Strength in Perseverance
2025-01-06.verse: James 1:2-4 - Count it all joy, my sisters, when you meet trials of various kinds, for you know that the testing of your faith produces steadfastness. And let steadfastness have its full effect, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing.
2025-01-06.text: The path of faith is not always easy; it's often filled with trials and challenges. James 1:2-4 invites us to consider these challenges an opportunity for spiritual growth. 'Count it all joy, my sisters, when you meet trials of various kinds, for you know that the testing of your faith produces steadfastness.' Perseverance is not a weakness, but a manifestation of God's strength in us. As women, we often want to overcome problems quickly, but God uses difficult moments to forge our character and our faith. He molds us to be more like Christ. What trial are you facing right now? Instead of complaining, pray that God will give you the strength to persevere. Remember that steadfastness produces a firm and complete character, one that is lacking in nothing.

2025-01-07.title: The Power of Prayer
2025-01-07.text: In the hustle and bustle of modern life, we often forget one of the most powerful weapons God has given us: prayer. 1 Thessalonians 5:17 encourages us to 'pray without ceasing.' This is not a suggestion, but a command. Prayer is our direct line of communication with our heavenly Father. As women, we sometimes think we have to solve our problems on our own, but God invites us to bring all our worries and requests to Him. Prayer doesn't change God; it changes us. It aligns us with His will and gives us peace in the midst of the storm. Have you made prayer a central part of your day? Are you bringing your burdens to God instead of trying to bear them alone? The woman who prays constantly is a woman who walks in the strength of God, not her own.

2025-01-08.title: Cultivating Integrity
2025-01-08.verse: Proverbs 10:9 - Whoever walks in integrity walks securely, but she who makes her ways crooked will be found out.
2025-01-08.text: Integrity is the quality of being honest and having strong moral principles; it's doing the right thing even when no one is watching. Proverbs 10:9 tells us, 'The one who walks in integrity walks securely, but she who perverts her ways will be found out.' As women of faith, our integrity should be our hallmark. Often, in the world of business or relationships, we are presented with opportunities to cut corners or hide the truth. However, a woman of God knows that her character is her greatest treasure. Integrity builds trust, not only with others, but also in our own conscience. Are you the same woman at home as you are at work or in church? Do your words align with your actions? Cultivate integrity in every aspect of your life and you will find true security in your walk.

2025-01-09.title: A Family's Purpose
2025-01-09.verse: Ephesians 5:25 - Husbands, love your wives, as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her.
2025-01-09.text: Ephesians 5:25 gives us one of the most challenging and rewarding instructions for husbands. While this verse is directed at them, we can learn from the standard of love Christ set for the church. It is a sacrificial love that gives itself completely. For a woman, this means supporting her husband with humility, serving with joy, and being a spiritual partner in the home. This kind of love doesn't come naturally; it is a choice we make daily, guided by the Holy Spirit. How can you show sacrificial love in your family today? Maybe it's through an act of service, a word of affirmation, or simply listening without interruption. Your family's purpose is intertwined with your commitment to love like Christ.

2025-01-10.title: Fresh Start
2025-01-10.verse: Lamentations 3:22-23 - The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases; His mercies never come to an end; they are new every morning; great is Your faithfulness.
2025-01-10.text: Every morning is a fresh start, a new opportunity to experience God's grace. Lamentations 3:22-23 reminds us that 'the steadfast love of the Lord never ceases; His mercies never come to an end; they are new every morning; great is Your faithfulness.' This is an incredible promise for the woman who feels weighed down by yesterday's failures. God's mercy is not a limited resource; it is renewed with every sunrise. You don't have to carry the burden of past mistakes or the shame of yesterday's sins. Today is a new day to walk in God's grace. How will you embrace this fresh start? Begin your day with a moment of gratitude for God's renewed mercies. Let this new morning be an invitation to recommit your heart and mind to Him.

2025-01-11.title: Finding Your Mission
2025-01-11.verse: Matthew 28:19-20 - Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, teaching them to observe all that I have commanded you. And behold, I am with you always, to the end of the age.
2025-01-11.text: After His resurrection, Jesus gave His disciples what we now call the Great Commission: 'Go therefore and make disciples of all nations.' This isn't just a command for missionaries or pastors; it's a mission for every woman who follows Christ. Our purpose is not just to exist, but to be a part of God's redemptive work in the world. As women, we are called to be mission-minded, whether in our home, our workplace, or our community. How can you be a 'goer' and a 'maker of disciples' in your daily life? Maybe it's by mentoring a younger woman at work, sharing your faith with a neighbor, or simply living a life that points others to Jesus. Your mission is not something you have to wait for; it begins today with the people God has placed in your life.

2025-01-12.title: Strength to Overcome
2025-01-12.verse: Philippians 4:13 - I can do all things through him who strengthens me.
2025-01-12.text: Life can present challenges that seem insurmountable. The weight of financial stress, family problems, or personal struggles can feel overwhelming. But Philippians 4:13 gives us a powerful truth to hold on to: 'I can do all things through him who strengthens me.' This is not a promise of an easy life, but a guarantee of supernatural strength. The 'all things' here refers to the ability to endure, to overcome, and to find peace in the midst of adversity. Your strength doesn't come from your own will or determination; it comes from Christ who lives in you. What mountain are you facing today? In this new year, don't face it alone. Ask God for the strength to climb it, knowing that His power is made perfect in your weakness. Your strength is not a sign of your ability, but a testament to His faithfulness.

2025-01-13.title: Leading with Humility
2025-01-13.verse: Philippians 2:3 - Do nothing from selfish ambition or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves.
2025-01-13.text: True leadership is not about power or control; it's about service and humility. Philippians 2:3 challenges us to 'do nothing from selfish ambition or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves.' In a world that values self-promotion, this verse calls women to a higher standard. A humble leader doesn't see herself as superior, but as a servant who lifts others up. This is the model of leadership that Christ showed us. It's about empowering your team, your family, and your friends to reach their full potential. How can you practice humility in your leadership today? Maybe it's by giving credit to others for a job well done, asking for advice, or simply listening to a subordinate's ideas. True influence comes not from a position, but from a heart of humility.

2025-01-14.title: The Joy of the Lord
2025-01-14.verse: Nehemiah 8:10 - Then he said to them, “Go your way, eat the fat and drink sweet wine and send portions to anyone who has nothing ready, for this day is holy to our Lord. And do not be grieved, for the joy of the Lord is your strength.”
2025-01-14.text: In the midst of life's struggles, it can be hard to find joy. But Nehemiah 8:10 reminds us of a powerful truth: 'The joy of the Lord is your strength.' This is not a joy based on circumstances, but a deep, abiding joy that comes from our relationship with God. It's a joy that sustains us through difficult times and gives us the strength to keep going. As women, we are often pressured to be tough and strong, but God invites us to find our joy in Him. This joy is a gift from the Holy Spirit, and it's available to us at all times. Where are you seeking joy today? Is it in your accomplishments, your possessions, or your relationships? True and lasting joy is found only in the Lord. Cultivate a heart of gratitude and you will find His joy as your strength.

2025-01-15.title: The Goal of Godliness
2025-01-15.verse: Philippians 3:14 - I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.
2025-01-15.text: At the start of a new year, we set goals for our careers, our health, and our finances. But what about our spiritual goals? Philippians 3:14 challenges us to 'press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.' Paul reminds us that our ultimate goal is not a worldly achievement, but the prize of knowing and becoming more like Christ. As women, we are called to be intentional about our spiritual growth. This means having a clear picture of who God wants us to be and taking deliberate steps to get there. What is one spiritual goal you can set for yourself this year? Maybe it's memorizing a new verse each week or serving in your church. Don't let your spiritual life be an afterthought. Press on toward the goal with the same determination you would any other important objective.

2025-01-16.title: The Habit of Morning
2025-01-16.verse: Psalm 5:3 - O Lord, in the morning you hear my voice; in the morning I prepare a sacrifice for you and watch.
2025-01-16.text: How you start your day often determines the course of your day. Psalm 5:3 gives us a powerful model for a morning routine: 'In the morning, O Lord, you hear my voice; in the morning I prepare a sacrifice for you and watch.' This verse highlights the importance of beginning our day with prayer and a focused time with God. As women, we are often pulled in a million directions from the moment we wake up. But by intentionally setting aside time for God, we are grounding ourselves in His truth and inviting His presence to guide our day. Don't let the noise of the world be the first thing you hear. Make a habit of spending time with God in the morning, and you will find a greater sense of peace and direction throughout your day.

2025-01-17.title: A Life of Character
2025-01-17.verse: Proverbs 20:7 - The righteous woman walks in her integrity; her children are blessed after her.
2025-01-17.text: The legacy of a woman is not measured by her wealth or her accomplishments, but by her character. Proverbs 20:7 states, 'The righteous woman walks in her integrity; her children are blessed after her.' This verse shows us the powerful ripple effect of a woman's character. Integrity, honesty, and self-control are not just virtues to be admired; they are the foundation of a life that honors God and blesses others. As women, we are called to build a life of character, not just for ourselves, but for the generations that follow us. Your children and grandchildren will be blessed by the example you set. How can you be a woman of character today? Start with the small things: be honest in your words, keep your promises, and act with virtue in all your dealings. A life of character is a lasting legacy.

2025-01-18.title: Renewing Your Marriage
2025-01-18.verse: 1 Peter 3:7 - Likewise, husbands, live with your wives in an understanding way, showing honor to the woman as the weaker vessel, since they are heirs with you of the grace of life, so that your prayers may not be hindered.
2025-01-18.text: In a world that often devalues marriage, 1 Peter 3:7 gives a profound instruction to husbands. While this verse is directed at them, we can learn from it about the importance of empathy, honor, and partnership in marriage. An 'understanding way' means making an effort to know your partner's heart, her needs, and her perspective. It's about being a team and honoring each other as equal heirs in Christ. As a wife, your prayer life is directly connected to how you treat your husband. Is there an area in your marriage that needs renewal? Take time today to show your husband honor and to understand his heart. A renewed marriage is a source of strength and a reflection of Christ's love.

2025-01-19.title: Leading with Decisions
2025-01-19.verse: Joshua 24:15 - But if serving the Lord seems undesirable to you, then choose for yourselves this day whom you will serve... As for me and my household, we will serve the Lord.
2025-01-19.text: Leaders are defined by their decisions. Joshua 24:15 gives us an iconic example of courageous leadership: 'But as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord.' Joshua wasn't just making a personal statement; he was setting a clear direction for his family and for the nation. As a woman, you are called to make bold, faith-filled decisions for your family and for those under your influence. This requires courage, wisdom, and a commitment to God's will. What important decision are you facing today? Maybe it's a career move, a financial choice, or a parenting decision. Before you act, take time to pray and seek God's guidance. A true leader doesn't make decisions based on what's easy or popular, but on what is right in the eyes of the Lord. Lead with the conviction that you and your house will serve the Lord.

2025-01-20.title: Peace in the Storm
2025-01-20.verse: John 14:27 - Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you. Not as the world gives do I give to you. Let not your hearts be troubled, neither let them be afraid.
2025-01-20.text: The world offers a temporary sense of calm, but only Jesus offers true, lasting peace. John 14:27 says, 'Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you. Not as the world gives do I give to you.' The peace of Christ is not the absence of conflict, but the presence of God in the midst of it. As a woman, you may be facing anxieties about your job, your family, or your future. But Jesus invites you to cast those anxieties on Him and to receive His peace. This peace is a gift from the Holy Spirit that guards your heart and your mind. It's a reminder that no matter what you're facing, God is in control. How can you find God's peace today? Take a moment to pause, breathe, and pray. Give your worries to Him and trust that He will sustain you. His peace is a fortress for your soul.

2025-01-21.title: Stewardship of Gifts
2025-01-21.verse: 1 Peter 4:10 - As each has received a gift, use it to serve one another, as good stewards of God's varied grace.
2025-01-21.text: God has given each of us unique gifts and talents, not for our own glory, but for the good of others. 1 Peter 4:10 reminds us, 'As each has received a gift, use it to serve one another, as good stewards of God's varied grace.' As women, we are called to be good stewards of everything God has entrusted to us: our time, our resources, and our abilities. This means using our gifts to build up the church and to serve the community. It's about recognizing that our talents are not our own, but a blessing from God to be shared. Are you using your gifts to serve others? Maybe you're a skilled artisan who can help with a church project, a leader who can mentor a young woman, or a good listener who can encourage a friend. Be a good steward of God's grace and use your gifts to bless others.

2025-01-22.title: Spiritual Habits
2025-01-22.verse: Joshua 1:8 - This Book of the Law shall not depart from your mouth, but you shall meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to do according to all that is written in it. For then you will make your way prosperous, and then you will have good success.
2025-01-22.text: The key to a strong spiritual life is not a single act, but a set of consistent habits. Joshua 1:8 gives us a clear instruction for success: 'This Book of the Law shall not depart from your mouth, but you shall meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to do according to all that is written in it.' The phrase 'meditate on it day and night' points to a life of constant engagement with God's Word. As women, we need to be intentional about creating spiritual habits that feed our souls. These habits—like daily scripture reading, prayer, and worship—are the bedrock of our faith. Don't leave your spiritual growth to chance. What is one spiritual habit you can implement today that will strengthen your walk with God? Start small and be consistent. Great spiritual growth comes from consistent spiritual habits.

2025-01-23.title: Perseverance in Faith
2025-01-23.verse: Hebrews 12:1-2 - Therefore, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us also lay aside every weight, and sin which clings so closely, and let us run with endurance the race that is set before us, looking to Jesus, the founder and perfecter of our faith, who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising the shame, and is seated at the right hand of the throne of God.
2025-01-23.text: Life can be a long-distance race, and the Christian journey is no different. Hebrews 12:1-2 encourages us to 'run with endurance the race that is set before us, looking to Jesus, the founder and perfecter of our faith.' The Christian life requires perseverance, the ability to keep going even when we feel like giving up. As women, we are often tempted to get distracted by the 'sin which clings so closely' and to lose sight of the finish line. But our focus should always be on Jesus. He is our ultimate example of perseverance. What is slowing you down in your race? What distraction or sin is weighing you down? Lay it aside today and fix your eyes on Jesus. Run the race with endurance, knowing that He is running with you and will see you through to the end.

2025-01-24.title: A Life of Honesty
2025-01-24.verse: Proverbs 12:22 - Lying lips are an abomination to the Lord, but those who act faithfully are his delight.
2025-01-24.text: In a world full of half-truths and deceit, the Christian woman is called to a life of radical honesty. Proverbs 12:22 says, 'Lying lips are an abomination to the Lord, but those who act faithfully are his delight.' This verse highlights a fundamental principle of God's character: He values truth. As women, our words carry weight. Our honesty builds trust and strengthens our relationships with our family, friends, and colleagues. Conversely, dishonesty erodes trust and can have devastating consequences. Is there an area in your life where you've been tempted to be less than honest? Today is a new day to choose truth. Be a woman who is known for her honesty, a woman whose word is her bond. A life of honesty is a life that delights the Lord.

2025-01-25.title: A Mother's Devotion
2025-01-25.verse: Malachi 4:6 - He will turn the hearts of fathers to their children and the hearts of children to their fathers, lest I come and strike the land with a decree of utter destruction.
2025-01-25.text: Malachi 4:6 gives us a powerful and sobering vision for the role of a parent: 'He will turn the hearts of the fathers to their children and the hearts of the children to their fathers.' This verse speaks to the divine mission of reconciliation and devotion within the family. As women, we have a sacred duty to be present and engaged in the lives of our children. This means more than just providing for them; it means building a relationship with them, listening to their hearts, and guiding them in their walk with God. In a world that often pulls mothers away from their families, we are called to be devoted and intentional. How can you turn your heart to your children today? Take a moment to play with them, to ask them about their day, or to read them a story. Your devotion to them is a reflection of God's devotion to you.

2025-01-26.title: The Power of Influence
2025-01-26.verse: Matthew 5:16 - In the same way, let your light shine before others, so that they may see your good works and give glory to your Father who is in heaven.
2025-01-26.text: Jesus calls us to be a light in a dark world. Matthew 5:16 says, 'In the same way, let your light shine before others, so that they may see your good works and give glory to your Father who is in heaven.' This is a call to a life of influence. As women, we have an incredible opportunity to impact those around us through our actions, our words, and our character. Our influence is not a tool for self-glorification, but a means to bring glory to God. How can you be a light in your workplace, your community, or your family? It could be through an act of kindness, a word of encouragement, or a commitment to excellence. Remember that your influence is a powerful tool. Use it wisely and intentionally to point others to Christ.

2025-01-27.title: Overcoming with God's Word
2025-01-27.verse: Psalm 119:105 - Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.
2025-01-27.text: When we feel lost or uncertain, God's Word is our compass and our guide. Psalm 119:105 says, 'Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.' This verse reminds us that we don't have to navigate life's challenges in the dark. God's Word provides the clarity and direction we need to overcome obstacles and to walk in His will. As women, we are often tempted to rely on our own wisdom or the advice of the world. But the true source of wisdom and guidance is found in scripture. Are you facing a difficult decision or a challenging situation? Turn to God's Word for guidance. Read, meditate, and pray on His truth. His Word will light your path and give you the strength to overcome.

2025-01-28.title: Spiritual Strength
2025-01-28.verse: Isaiah 40:31 - But they who wait for the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings like eagles; they shall run and not be weary; they shall walk and not faint.
2025-01-28.text: The burdens of life can leave us feeling weak and weary. But Isaiah 40:31 offers a powerful promise: 'But they who wait for the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings like eagles; they shall run and not be weary; they shall walk and not faint.' This verse is a reminder that our strength does not come from our own efforts, but from waiting on the Lord. As women, we are often taught to be self-sufficient, but God invites us to rely on Him for our strength. 'Waiting' on the Lord is not passive; it's an active reliance on Him through prayer, worship, and the reading of His Word. Where are you feeling weary today? Give that weariness to God and wait for Him to renew your strength. He will give you the power to soar above your circumstances.

2025-01-29.title: Resolutions for the Soul
2025-01-29.verse: Romans 12:2 - Do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewal of your mind, that by testing you may discern what is the will of God, what is good and acceptable and perfect.
2025-01-29.text: At the beginning of a new year, many people make resolutions. But how many of these resolutions are for the soul? Romans 12:2 challenges us to 'be transformed by the renewal of your mind.' This is a call to make resolutions that go beyond the physical and the superficial. A woman who seeks to renew her mind is a woman who is intentional about her thoughts, her beliefs, and her spiritual growth. She is not conformed to the patterns of the world but is transformed by God's Word. What resolution can you make today to renew your mind? Maybe it's a commitment to read a Christian book, to listen to a new podcast, or to spend more time in worship. A renewed mind is the key to a transformed life.

2025-01-30.title: Self-Control for Growth
2025-01-30.verse: Galatians 5:22-23 - But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness, self-control; against such things there is no law.
2025-01-30.text: Self-control is often seen as a sign of strength, and it's a key component of a godly character. Galatians 5:22-23 lists 'self-control' as a fruit of the Spirit. This means that self-control is not something we can muster up on our own; it is a supernatural gift from God that we cultivate through our relationship with Him. A woman of self-control is a woman who is a master of her own desires and impulses. She is not ruled by her emotions or her appetites, but is guided by the Holy Spirit. In this new year, where do you need more self-control? Maybe it's with your words, your temper, or your spending habits. Pray for the Holy Spirit to give you the strength to grow in this area. Self-control is a sign of spiritual maturity and a key to a life of growth.

2025-01-31.title: A Legacy of Trust
2025-01-31.verse: Proverbs 3:5-6 - Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths.
2025-01-31.text: As the month of January comes to a close, we can look back and see how we've started this new year. But what does the rest of the year hold? Proverbs 3:5-6 gives us the ultimate guidance for the journey ahead: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths.' This is a call to a life of radical trust in God. As women, we often lean on our own understanding and try to figure everything out on our own. But God invites us to trust in His wisdom, which is far greater than our own. How will you trust God with the rest of your year? Acknowledge Him in your decisions, your plans, and your dreams. Trust Him with all your heart, and He will make your path straight.
